page.title: 11HOLME VALLEY INDUSTRY - 1
page.content:
The traditional principal industry of the valley is{wool textiles.}This developed because of geographical factors. Surrounding moors provided rough grazing for sheep and so a local wool supply. The districts soft water proved ideal for wool processes. The fast flowing streams and rivers gave power for water wheels. Many{Weavers' Cottages,}from when the industry was domestically based, survive around Honley. These are three stone buildings. The upper floors have many windows to provide working light. From later years there are, along the river, numerous{mills}and weirs. Textiles stimulated other industries particularly{Chemicals}(for dyes etc.) and{Engineering}(for machinery etc.).
